title: Representing Supply Chain Events on the Web of Data

author: Monika Solanki, Department of Computer Science, University of Oxford

segmentation: Today I'll be talking about some work that we've been doing within the context of the Five Space Project, 5 Spaces, a future Internet project that is looking into building business collaboration networks for the agrifood domain.
So basically looking at Agri food transport and logistics.
What we want to do is look at these supply chains and see how information flows through the supply chain supply chain as a domain is a large producer and consumer of data sets.

The problem though is that these datasets within supply chain so far have existed in isolation, so we know that we have a huge web of data out there that provides us with all sorts of hetrogenous information which can be integrated successfully within with the supply chain data to give us enhanced knowledge, But this has not been happening so far because.
All the supply chain knowledge has been bottled up within the individual repositories of the supply chain trading partners, so in.
This work what we have tried to do is we have looked at supply chains.

We have looked at a specific standard that is being used within supply chain domains to capture the knowledge and we have tried to provide ontological models that will help the domain to represent their knowledge on the web of data.
